data.value: This function computes the coefficients of a finite impulse response filter. The filter will have linear phase; it will be Type I if
is odd and Type II if
Type II filters always have zero response at the Nyquist frequency, so a ValueError exception is raised if firwin is called with
even and having a passband whose right end is at the Nyquist frequency.
Length of the filter (number of coefficients, i.e. the filter order + 1).
must be odd if a passband includes the Nyquist frequency.

data.value: If True, the gain at the frequency 0 (i.e., the "DC gain") is 1. If False, the DC gain is 0. Can also be a string argument for the desired filter type (equivalent to
Set to True to scale the coefficients so that the frequency response is exactly unity at a certain frequency. That frequency is either:
0 (DC) if the first passband starts at 0 (i.e. pass_zero   is True)
